title: Case Study: Boutonniere Deformity of the Right Ring Finger in a Carpenter
clinical_history: Mr. Simon Hartwell is a 47-year-old carpenter presenting with a progressive flexion deformity of his right ring finger over the past 3 weeks following a laceration injury at work. Over the last 10 days, he has noticed increasing difficulty in straightening the middle joint of his ring finger while the fingertip seems to hyperextend. He is unable to fully extend the affected finger, and this has significantly affected his ability to grip and manipulate tools, impacting his work productivity.
